raw_text:
Surprise win for anti-Bush film
 
 Michael Moore's anti-Bush documentary Fahrenheit 9/11 has won best film at the US People's Choice Awards, voted for by the US public.
 
 Mel Gibson's The Passion of the Christ won best drama, despite both films being snubbed so far at US film awards in the run-up to February's Oscars. Julia Roberts won her 10th consecutive crown as favourite female movie star. Johnny Depp was favourite male movie star and Renee Zellweger was favourite leading lady at Sunday's awards in LA.
 
 Film sequel Shrek 2 took three prizes - voted top animated movie, top film comedy and top sequel. In television categories, Desperate Housewives was named top new drama and Joey, starring former Friends actor Matt LeBlanc, was best new comedy. Long-running shows Will and Grace and CSI: Crime Scene Investigation were named best TV comedy and TV drama respectively.
 
 Nominees for the People's Choice Awards were picked by a 6,000-strong Entertainment Weekly magazine panel, and winners were subsequently chosen by 21 million online voters. Fahrenheit 9/11 director Michael Moore dedicated his trophy to soldiers in Iraq. His film was highly critical of President George W Bush and the US-led invasion of Iraq, and Moore was an outspoken Bush critic in the 2004 presidential campaign inwhich Democratic challenger John Kerry lost.
 
 "This country is still all of ours, not right or left or Democrat or Republican," Moore told the audience at the ceremony in Pasadena, California. Moore said it was "an historic occasion" that the 31-year-old awards ceremony would name a documentary its best film. Unlike many other film-makers, Passion of the Christ director Mel Gibson has vowed not to campaign for an Oscar for his movie. "To me, really, this is the ultimate goal because one doesn't make work for the elite," Gibson said backstage at the event. "To me, the people have spoken."
llama3.2:1b:
Michael Moore's film Fahrenheit 9/11 won best film at the US People's Choice Awards. 

Mel Gibson won best drama for The Passion of the Christ despite both films being snubbed in US awards. 

Julia Roberts was named favourite female movie star again, Johnny Depp was named favourite male movie star, and Renee Zellweger was named leading lady.

Shrek 2 took three prizes: top animated movie, top film comedy, and top sequel. 

Desperate Housewives won top new drama category in TV categories, and Joey (Matt LeBlanc) won best new comedy.

Will and Grace won best TV comedy, and CSI: Crime Scene Investigation won best TV drama.
llama3.2:3b: Fahrenheit 9/11 won best film at US People's Choice Awards, beating Mel Gibson's The Passion of the Christ. Julia Roberts won her 10th consecutive crown as favourite female movie star, and Johnny Depp and Renee Zellweger took top spots for favourite male actor and leading lady respectively. Shrek 2 took three prizes, while Desperate Housewives and CSI: Crime Scene Investigation won in TV categories.
gemma2:2b: Michael Moore's anti-Bush film *Fahrenheit 9/11* won best film at the US People's Choice Awards, chosen by public vote.  Other winners included *Shrek 2*, which took top honors in animation and comedy categories; *Desperate Housewives* for TV drama; and *Joey* for TV comedy.  Mel Gibson's *The Passion of the Christ* was awarded best drama despite being overlooked at other awards. Julia Roberts won her tenth consecutive award for favourite female movie star, while Johnny Depp was named favorite male movie star and Renee Zellweger was top leading lady.
qwen2.5:0.5b: The US People's Choice Awards honored Michael Moore's anti-Bush documentary Fahrenheit 9/11 with its Best Film award. The film's director was nominated by a panel of experts and won despite receiving lower praise from the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences. The film also garnered high scores in television awards, including being named best new drama and comedy. Additionally, Desperate Housewives topped the long-running TV categories, and Matt LeBlanc starred in Joey, who won for its best comedy.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Michael Moore's anti-Bush documentary Fahrenheit 9/11 wins best film at the US People's Choice Awards, while Mel Gibson's The Passion of the Christ takes drama honors despite being overlooked earlier in Oscar voting, with Julia Roberts winning her 10th straight title as top female movie star. Shrek 2 scoops three awards, Desperate Housewives tops new drama category, and Will and Grace and CSI: Crime Scene Investigation claim best TV comedy and drama respectively. The event is held at Pasadena's Grauman's Egyptian Theatre, with Moore dedicating his trophy to Iraq veterans.
qwen2.5:3b: Michael Moore's anti-Bush film Fahrenheit 9/11 won best film at US People's Choice Awards, with Mel Gibson's The Passion of the Christ winning best drama despite being overlooked by other major awards leading up to Oscars. Other winners included Shrek 2 for animated and comedy categories, and Desperate Housewives for new drama in TV categories. Moore dedicated his award to Iraq soldiers, criticizing Bush and opposing him in the 2004 election. Gibson said he would not campaign for an Oscar as it is "for the elite," emphasizing that voters' choice was important.
opencoder:1.5b:
The surprising win for anti-Bush film is Michael Moore's Fahrenheit 9/11 documentary won by US People's Choice Awards with three different nominations: The Passion of the Christ, best drama, and top animated movie.
 
Film sequel Shrek 2 was nominally chosen in television categories but won not be listed as a nominee. Best TV comedy was Desperate Housewives, and best new comedy was Joey from the previous installment of the series.

tinyllama:1.1b: The People's Choice Awards has awarded its top awards to Michael Moore's anti-Bush documentary Fahrienheit 9/11, which was highly criticized by Democratic candidate John Kerry in the 2004 presidential campaign. The film has won best film and best drama for its portrayal of the United States under the administration of George W. Bush, despite being snubbed at previous awards ceremonies. In television categories, the show Desperate Housewives has been named best new comedy and CSI: Crime Scene Investigation best TV drama. Nominees for People's Choice Awards were selected by a 6,000-strong Entertainment Weekly magazine panel, and winners were voted online by 21 million viewers. Moore dedicated his trophy to soldiers in Iraq.
tinydolphin:1.1b: The US People's Choice Awards took place recently in Pasadena, California. Fahrenheit 9/11, a documentary by Michael Moore, won best film for the second consecutive year and was voted as the favorite among US movie enthusiasts. The Passion of the Christ, another film directed by Mel Gibson, won the top prize for drama. Julia Roberts, Renee Zellweger, Johnny Depp, and Ricky Gervais were other notable winners in various categories. In television, long-running shows like Will and Grace and CSI: Crime Scene Investigation received nominations. The People's Choice Awards, aired on TNT in the US, were picked by an Entertainment Weekly magazine panel and received a large number of online votes.
phi:2.7b:
Fahrenheit 9/11 by Michael Moore has won best film at the US People's Choice Awards voted on by the public in December. Mel Gibson'a The Passion of the Christ won best drama despite being snubbed earlier this year at US film awards before February'S Oscars. Julia Roberts was favourite for 10th consecutive time as female movie star and Johnny Depp for male movie star while Renee Zellweger won favorite leading lady at Sunday's awards in LA. 

Shrek 2, an animated movie sequel, took three prizes: top animated movie, top film comedy, and best sequel. Desperate Housewives was named the top new drama, while Joey, a former Friends actor Matt LeBlanc starred, won best new comedy. Long-running shows Will & Grace and CSI: Crime Scene Investigation were nominated as TV comedy and TV drama respectively. 

Fahrenheit 9/11 director Michael Moore dedicated his trophy to soldiers in Iraq because his film was critical of President George W. Bush's invasion of Iraq, while Mel Gibson vowed not to campaign for an Oscar for Passion of the Christ because he believes that everyone should be able to make work regardless of their political beliefs.

The film was highly critical of President George W Bush and the US-led invasion of Iraq, and Moore was an outspoken Bush critic in the 2004 presidential campaign in which Democratic challenger John Kerry lost.

Julia Roberts won her 10th consecutive title as Favorite Female Movie Star, while Johnny Depp and Renee Zellweger were named Favorite Male Movie Star and Favorite Leading Lady, respectively. *Shrek 2* won three awards, including Top Animated Movie. In television, *Desperate Housewives* was named Top New Drama, *Joey* won Best New Comedy, and *Will & Grace* and *CSI* were recognized as Best TV Comedy and Drama. Winners were chosen by 21 million online voters. Moore dedicated his award to soldiers in Iraq and emphasized unity beyond political divisions. He noted the historic nature of a documentary winning Best Film. Mel Gibson, director of *The Passion of the Christ*, stated he would not campaign for an Oscar, emphasizing that his film was made for the public rather than the elite.
stablelm2:1.6b: Michael Moore's anti-Bush documentary "Fahrenheit 9/10" won best film at the US People's Choice Awards, despite being snubbed by other awards shows. The Passion of the Christ took best drama, while Shrek 2 was named top animated movie and top film comedy. granite3.1-dense:2b: Michael Moore's anti-Bush documentary Fahrenheit 9/11 emerged as the unexpected winner of the US People's Choice Awards for best film, having been largely overlooked by major film awards preceding the Oscars. The ceremony, held in Pasadena, California, with 21 million online voters, also recognized Julia Roberts as top female movie star (10th consecutive win), Johnny Depp as best male actor, and Renée Zellweger for leading lady. Shrek 2 took three accolades: top animated movie, film comedy, and sequel. In television, Desperate Housewives won new drama, while Joey, starring Matt LeBlanc, was best new comedy. Will & Grace and CSI: Crime Scene Investigation were named best TV comedy and drama respectively. Fahrenheit 9/11 director Michael Moore, an outspoken Bush critic during the 2004 presidential campaign, dedicated his award to soldiers in Iraq, emphasizing unity beyond political divisions: "This country is still all of ours." Mel Gibson, Passion of the Christ director, expressed satisfaction with the People's Choice victory, viewing it as more significant than an Oscar win.
reference: Moore said it was "an historic occasion" that the 31-year-old awards ceremony would name a documentary its best film.Michael Moore's anti-Bush documentary Fahrenheit 9/11 has won best film at the US People's Choice Awards, voted for by the US public.Mel Gibson's The Passion of the Christ won best drama, despite both films being snubbed so far at US film awards in the run-up to February's Oscars.Johnny Depp was favourite male movie star and Renee Zellweger was favourite leading lady at Sunday's awards in LA.In television categories, Desperate Housewives was named top new drama and Joey, starring former Friends actor Matt LeBlanc, was best new comedy.His film was highly critical of President George W Bush and the US-led invasion of Iraq, and Moore was an outspoken Bush critic in the 2004 presidential campaign inwhich Democratic challenger John Kerry lost.
